title: Conditionals: Zero & First
description: Слушайте условные предложения нулевого и первого типа.

tasks.audioText: Our chemistry teacher always reminds us about safety. If you heat water to a hundred degrees, it boils.
tasks.transcript: If you heat water to a hundred degrees, it boils.

options.text: Water always reaches boiling point at a hundred degrees.
Water might boil at a hundred degrees sometimes.
Water will boil only if you heat it very slowly.
Water never boils at a hundred degrees.

tasks.explanation: Zero conditional states a scientific fact — if + present, present. Heating to 100°C always causes boiling.

tasks.audioText: The weather forecast looks promising for the weekend. If it stays sunny, we will have a barbecue in the garden.
tasks.transcript: If it stays sunny, we will have a barbecue in the garden.

options.text: We had a barbecue last weekend.
We plan to barbecue outdoors on the condition that the weather is good.
We will have a barbecue regardless of the weather.
We never have barbecues in the garden.

tasks.explanation: First conditional: if + present simple, will + base verb. A real future possibility depending on weather.

tasks.audioText: The doctor gave me strict instructions. If you don't take antibiotics regularly, the infection returns.
tasks.transcript: If you don't take antibiotics regularly, the infection returns.

options.text: Skipping antibiotics always leads to the infection coming back.
The infection might return if you take antibiotics.
Antibiotics cause infections to return.
The infection will never return.

tasks.explanation: Zero conditional for a medical fact — missing antibiotics consistently leads to infection recurrence.

tasks.audioText: My manager mentioned a possible promotion at our last meeting. If I complete this project successfully, I will get promoted to team lead.
tasks.transcript: If I complete this project successfully, I will get promoted to team lead.

options.text: I was promoted to team lead last month.
I will be promoted no matter what happens with the project.
A successful project completion will result in my promotion.
I will complete the project after getting promoted.

tasks.explanation: First conditional with a real future outcome: completing the project leads to the promotion.

tasks.audioText: The driving instructor explained the basic rules again. If you press the brake pedal, the car slows down.
tasks.transcript: If you press the brake pedal, the car slows down.

options.text: Pressing the brake always makes the car decelerate.
The car speeds up when you press the brake.
You should never press the brake pedal.
The car might slow down if the brake works.

tasks.explanation: Zero conditional for a general mechanical fact — braking always causes deceleration.

tasks.audioText: I'm worried about the final exam next week. If I don't pass the exam, I will have to retake the entire course.
tasks.transcript: If I don't pass the exam, I will have to retake the entire course.

options.text: Failing the exam will force me to repeat the whole course.
I already failed and retook the course.
I will retake the course even if I pass.
Passing the exam has no effect on the course.

tasks.explanation: First conditional with a negative condition: not passing leads to the consequence of retaking the course.

tasks.audioText: The gardener shared a useful tip with us. If you water plants in the evening, they absorb moisture more efficiently.
tasks.transcript: If you water plants in the evening, they absorb moisture more efficiently.

options.text: Evening watering helps plants take in water better.
Plants should only be watered in the morning.
Watering in the evening kills the plants.
Plants never need to be watered.

tasks.explanation: Zero conditional for a general truth about gardening — evening watering consistently improves absorption.

tasks.audioText: The travel agent offered us a deal this morning. If we book the trip before Wednesday, we will receive a fifteen percent discount.
tasks.transcript: If we book the trip before Wednesday, we will receive a fifteen percent discount.

options.text: We received the discount last Wednesday.
Booking before Wednesday guarantees us a fifteen percent price reduction.
The discount applies only after Wednesday.
There is no discount available for this trip.

tasks.explanation: First conditional: a real, time-limited offer — booking before the deadline leads to the discount.

tasks.audioText: The biology textbook explains this clearly. If an animal loses its habitat, it migrates to a new area or faces extinction.
tasks.transcript: If an animal loses its habitat, it migrates to a new area or faces extinction.

options.text: Habitat loss forces animals to either relocate or risk dying out.
Animals always adapt perfectly to habitat loss.
Animals choose to lose their habitat voluntarily.
Habitat loss only affects plants, not animals.

tasks.explanation: Zero conditional for a biological principle — habitat loss consistently results in migration or extinction.

tasks.audioText: My colleague is thinking about applying for a grant. If she submits the application on time, she will probably receive funding.
tasks.transcript: If she submits the application on time, she will probably receive funding.

options.text: She already received the funding.
She will likely get funding if her application is submitted by the deadline.
She will receive funding even without applying.
She decided not to apply for the grant.

tasks.explanation: First conditional with 'probably' — a likely outcome if the real condition of timely submission is met.

tasks.audioText: The nutritionist gave a clear warning during the seminar. If you consume too much sugar, your body stores it as fat.
tasks.transcript: If you consume too much sugar, your body stores it as fat.

options.text: Excess sugar consumption always leads to fat storage in the body.
Sugar is converted into muscle, not fat.
Eating sugar has no effect on the body.
Your body only stores fat from protein.

tasks.explanation: Zero conditional for a nutritional fact — overconsumption of sugar invariably results in fat storage.

tasks.audioText: The landlord called about the lease renewal. If we sign the new contract this week, we will keep the same rental price for another year.
tasks.transcript: If we sign the new contract this week, we will keep the same rental price for another year.

options.text: We signed the contract last year.
The rent will increase no matter what.
Signing this week will lock in our current rent for one more year.
We already moved out of the flat.

tasks.explanation: First conditional: a real, time-sensitive condition — signing this week secures the unchanged rent.

tasks.audioText: The IT technician explained the problem clearly. If you restart the router, the connection resets automatically.
tasks.transcript: If you restart the router, the connection resets automatically.

options.text: Restarting the router always causes the connection to reset on its own.
The connection resets only when the router breaks.
You should never restart the router.
Restarting the router deletes all your files.

tasks.explanation: Zero conditional for a technical fact — restarting the router consistently resets the connection.

tasks.audioText: The fitness coach gave us an important reminder before the session. If you stretch properly before exercising, you will avoid muscle injuries.
tasks.transcript: If you stretch properly before exercising, you will avoid muscle injuries.

options.text: Proper stretching before a workout will help prevent muscle damage.
Stretching causes muscle injuries.
You should never stretch before exercise.
Injuries happen regardless of stretching.

tasks.explanation: First conditional with advice — proper stretching leads to the positive result of avoiding injuries.

tasks.audioText: The shop assistant explained the return policy. If a customer returns a product within thirty days, they receive a full refund.
tasks.transcript: If a customer returns a product within thirty days, they receive a full refund.

options.text: Returning a product within a month always results in a complete refund.
Customers can only get a partial refund.
Products cannot be returned under any circumstances.
The refund takes sixty days to process.

tasks.explanation: Zero conditional for a store policy — returning within the time frame consistently guarantees a full refund.
